Remarks.
Lesteva l. longoelytrata
is a West Palaearctic subspecies, distributed in Orkney Islands , Faroe Islands , Iceland and Britain Isles through North Africa, Europe, Caucasus, Turkey , Lebanon , Cyprus , Turkmenistan and Iran ( Shavrin 2014 ), replaced by L. l. maura
Erichson, 1840
in Corsica and Sardinia, and by L. l. cretica Lohse & Steel, 1961 in Crete ( Zanetti 1987 ). The status of these subspecies requires confirmation. In North Africa L .
l . longoelytrata
is known from Morocco ( Koch 1941 , Coiffait 1973 ) and Algeria ( Fauvel 1878 , 1886 , 1902 ). This species is very common in the Iberian Peninsula ( Gamarra & Outerelo 2008 ) and known from both Portugal and Spain ( Kiesenwetter 1851 , Heyden 1870 , Quedenfeldt 1884 , Champion & Chapman 1905 , Lindberg & Bernhauer 1931 , Koch 1940 , Jeannel & Jarrige 1949 , Jarrige 1954 , Lohse 1960 , Outerelo et al. 1998 , etc.).
